availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Louis Kinstler (Christian County, Kentucky, merchant and detective)

body.p: Christian County, Kentucky, merchant and detective. Native of Germany. Married to Susan Ake Kinstler in Jackson County, Alabama, on June 29, 1854. Father of Lucy Kinstler. Merchant in Christian County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Christian County in 1860. Detective for the United States in 1863. Charged by military commission with accepting bribes in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on March 29, 1864. Detective for the United States in 1864. Detective in Jefferson County, Kentucky, in 1865.

"Personal." Courier-Journal, (Louisville, KY), Oct. 8, 1866.
